sampleArticles: Waymo's Robotaxis Are Coming to London

articles: Waymo's Robotaxis Are Coming to London
OpenAI has five years to turn $13 billion into $1 trillion | TechCrunch
summaries: Waymo plans to launch robotaxi service in London in 2026, pending UK regulatory approval, marking its first international autonomous taxi service and facing new challenges with the city's complex medieval street layout.

OpenAI is generating $13B in annual revenue primarily from ChatGPT subscriptions, but faces the challenge of funding over $1T in computing infrastructure commitments over the next decade through various expansion strategies including government contracts and computing services.

summaries: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman announced plans to relax ChatGPT's safety restrictions, including allowing verified adult users to engage in erotic conversations and making the AI's responses more friendly, following claims that mental health concerns have been mitigated.

rawData.title: Waymo's Robotaxis Are Coming to London
rawData.summary: Waymo plans to launch robotaxi service in London in 2026, pending UK regulatory approval, marking its first international autonomous taxi service and facing new challenges with the city's complex medieval street layout.

rawData.title: Waymo’s robotaxis are coming to London
rawData.summary: Waymo plans to launch its first international fully driverless robotaxi service in London by 2026, with supervised testing beginning in the coming weeks ahead of the UK's planned rollout of autonomous vehicle regulations.

rawData.title: The Beads Revolution: How I Built The TODO System That AI Agents Actually Want to Use
rawData.summary: A developer created Beads, an open-source task management system specifically designed for AI agents that provides structured, queryable data and hierarchical issue tracking, gaining significant GitHub traction within days of launch.

rawData.title: OpenAI has five years to turn $13 billion into $1 trillion | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: OpenAI is generating $13B in annual revenue primarily from ChatGPT subscriptions, but faces the challenge of funding over $1T in computing infrastructure commitments over the next decade through various expansion strategies including government contracts and computing services.

rawData.title: Samsung officially teases Moohan headset launch for next week
rawData.summary: Samsung will unveil its Project Moohan mixed reality headset running Android XR at a 'Worlds Wide Open' event on October 21st, marking the first device built for this new platform developed with Google and Qualcomm.

rawData.title: Netflix is making a big bet on video podcasts
rawData.summary: Netflix is partnering with Spotify to bring 16 video podcast series, including The Bill Simmons Podcast and various Ringer shows, to its streaming platform in the US starting in 2026.

rawData.title: Google’s Pixel 10 Pro Fold is the first to ‘go up in smoke during a bend test,’ JerryRigEverything says
rawData.summary: During JerryRigEverything's durability test of the Google Pixel 10 Pro Fold, the device's battery caught fire and emitted smoke after extreme bending, marking the first such incident in the YouTuber's decade of testing phones, though iFixit experts suggest this may be due to testing conditions rather than a design flaw.

rawData.title: Sam Altman says ChatGPT will soon allow erotica for adult users | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman announced plans to relax ChatGPT's safety restrictions, including allowing verified adult users to engage in erotic conversations and making the AI's responses more friendly, following claims that mental health concerns have been mitigated.

rawData.title: YouTube has a new video player
rawData.summary: YouTube is rolling out a redesigned video player across mobile, web, and TV platforms with rounded, translucent buttons and a cleaner interface that aims to be less intrusive to the viewing experience.

rawData.title: Facebook removes ICE-tracking page after US government ‘outreach’
rawData.summary: Meta removed a Facebook page tracking ICE operations in Chicago after DOJ outreach, following similar takedowns of ICE-tracking apps by Apple and Google, raising questions about government pressure on platforms to remove legal speech.

rawData.title: Apple teases M5 MacBook
rawData.summary: Apple is teasing the launch of a new MacBook featuring an M5 chip, with marketing SVP Greg Joswiak posting cryptic hints on social media suggesting an imminent announcement alongside potential iPad Pro updates.

rawData.title: You Can Get 4 Apple Airtags for $65 Right Now
rawData.summary: Apple AirTags are on sale for $65 for a four-pack (34% off), offering iPhone users precise item tracking through Apple's extensive device network with built-in safety features to prevent unwanted tracking.

rawData.title: Sam Altman says ChatGPT will soon sext with verified adults
rawData.summary: OpenAI plans to allow adult users to engage in erotic conversations with ChatGPT once age verification is implemented in December 2023, as part of the company's 'treat adult users like adults' principle.

rawData.title: Nvidia sells tiny new computer that puts big AI on your desktop
rawData.summary: Nvidia announced the DGX Spark, a $4,000 desktop AI computer that delivers 1 petaflop of computing performance with 128GB unified memory, capable of running AI models with up to 200 billion parameters locally.

rawData.title: California cracks down on ‘predatory’ early cancellation fees
Google's Gemini can now help you schedule Google Calendar meetings | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Google is launching a Gemini-powered 'Help me schedule' feature in Gmail that suggests meeting times based on calendar availability and email context, automatically creating calendar invites when recipients select a time slot.

rawData.title: This Watch Brand Has Made a Completely New Kind of Strap Using Lasers
rawData.summary: Watch brand Ming has developed a revolutionary 3D-printed watch strap called Polymesh, made from titanium with 1,693 interconnected pieces that combines the comfort of fabric with the strength of metal, requiring no pins or screws for assembly.

rawData.title: Google Meet launches an AI-powered makeup feature | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Google Meet has introduced an AI-powered makeup filter with 12 different options that stays in place during movement, competing with similar features in Microsoft Teams and Zoom.

rawData.title: Coco Robotics taps UCLA professor to lead new physical AI research lab | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Coco Robotics has appointed UCLA professor Bolei Zhou to lead its new physical AI research lab, aiming to leverage millions of miles of delivery robot data to advance automation capabilities for its last-mile delivery fleet.

rawData.title: You'll soon be able to shop Walmart from ChatGPT | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Walmart is partnering with OpenAI to enable direct shopping through ChatGPT, allowing users to link their Walmart accounts, browse items, and check out within the chatbot interface when the feature launches this fall.
